docs.lead_paragraph: “The Nine Lives of Chloe King” and “Switched at Birth,” new shows on ABC Family, follow that network’s trend of paying very little tribute to the conventional family.

docs.lead_paragraph: Studies show that the zone at the end of the pediatric period is fraught with uncertainties and risks, especially for children with chronic illnesses and disabilities.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers found that mothers of children with autism were significantly less likely than mothers of children without autism to have taken prenatal vitamins when recommended.

headline.main: Patterns: Prenatal Vitamins May Ward Off Autism
headline.print_headline: PATTERNS: Prenatal Vitamins May Ward Off Autism

docs.snippet: Researchers found that mothers of children with autism were significantly less likely than mothers of children without autism to have taken prenatal vitamins when recommended.

docs.lead_paragraph: TV networks are increasingly in the news for their willingness to pay for exclusive access to news subjects.

headline.seo: ABC and NBC Pay Newsmakers to Be Interviewed
headline.main: For Instant Ratings, Interviews With a Checkbook

docs.snippet: TV networks are increasingly in the news for their willingness to pay for exclusive access to news subjects.

byline.original: By BRIAN STELTER and BILL CARTER

docs.lead_paragraph: Before the subjects of headlining news stories agree to a television interview these days, some have one question: how much money can I make? ABC and NBC, embroiled in a fight for viewers in the mornings, are increasingly in the news for their willingness to pay thousands of dollars to gain exclusive access to news subjects.
docs.abstract: TV networks like ABC and NBC are increasingly willing to pay for exclusive access to interview news subjects; some say practice could change the nature of news and destroy the credibility and standards of of networks; photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Road Runners are dedicating the race to Grete Waitz, a five-time winner who died in April at age 57.

headline.seo: 40th New York Mini 10K to Celebrate Waitz
headline.main: 40th New York Mini Is Dedicated to Waitz
headline.print_headline: 40th New York Mini Is Dedicated to Waitz

docs.abstract: New York Road Runners are dedicating its 40th Mini Marathon, which started in 1972 as a women-only race, to beloved Norwegian marathoner Grete Waitz, who died April.
docs.snippet: The New York Road Runners are dedicating the race to Grete Waitz, a five-time winner who died in April at age 57.

docs.lead_paragraph: Backed by the Orthodox Church, the Russian anti-abortion movement is using its American counterpart as a model, even adopting the English-language term “pro-life” as its own.

headline.main: Russians Adopt U.S. Tactics in Opposing Abortion

docs.snippet: Backed by the Orthodox Church, the Russian anti-abortion movement is using its American counterpart as a model, even adopting the English-language term “pro-life” as its own.

docs.lead_paragraph: Liz O’Connell is a professional horsewoman who just finished foaling season and is looking for new adventures. She is a member of the New York State Task Force on Retired Race Horses and spends too much time rehoming off-the-track thoroughbreds.

headline.main: Better Than Honour Joins Racing’s Royalty

docs.abstract: The Kentucky Thoroughbred Owners and Breeders’ Broodmare of the Year for 2007, Better Than Honour, has joined that pantheon.
